descriptionModule.briefSummary: We are conducting a three-group comparative study on stroke patients. The treatment is started in a subacute state and completed in the hospital. The essence of robot-assisted treatments is faster recovery and better learning to walk. The group will do a special walking exercise with a robot. The walking group does the same training, only without robotic assistance. The control group will receive physiotherapy treatments financed by the state. Control examination after 3 weeks.

interventions.description: The patients completed a 1-hour learning to walk program using a soft exoskeleton. The protocol includes several difficult parts of the walk. (Walking protocol)

interventions.name: Walking group
interventions.description: The walking protocol was performed without robotic assistance for 1 hour every day for 3 weeks.

interventions.name: Control group
interventions.description: The control group performed the physiotherapy treatment for 3 weeks.
